recipes.title: Pecan Stuffed French Toast
recipes.attribution: Ann Dodge, The Grand Victoria Inn, Thomasville, GA, by C. Kehoe
recipes.description: Elegant stuffed French toast with cream cheese and pecans.

instructions.text: Blend cream cheese, vanilla, nuts, and 1 tablespoon sugar. Slice bread almost through every other slice to form pocket.
Spread with 1 tablespoon cream cheese mixture in each pocket.
Mix eggs, water, and other tablespoon of sugar. Dip bread and let it soak in mixture for a few minutes.
Fry on griddle or in pan with butter flavored shortening.
Sprinkle with cinnamon or nutmeg. Serve with maple syrup or fruit sauce.

notes: From The Grand Victoria Inn in Thomasville, Georgia

assumptions: Inferred 2 for butter flavored shortening (standard quantity)
Assumed 1 unit for cinnamon and/or nutmeg

recipes.title: Sausage-Apple Pocket
recipes.description: Turkey sausage and apple in a pita pocket with pancake syrup.

ingredients.item: fresh mild turkey breakfast sausage links
small red or Golden Delicious apple
ingredients.prep_note: about 1/4 lb, cored, pared, and thinly sliced

instructions.text: Spray skillet with nonstick cooking spray; add sausages and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add apples and stir to combine; cover and cook until apples are tender and soft, about 3 minutes.
Stir in syrup and cook, stirring constantly, until thoroughly heated, about 1 minute.
Open pita to form pocket. Fill pocket with apple sausage mixture.

notes: A lighter breakfast option with turkey sausage

missing_inputs: Not in database: reduced-calorie pancake syrup

recipes.title: Pancakes for Four
recipes.description: Classic buttermilk pancakes recipe sized for four people.

instructions.text: Sift flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and soda into a medium size bowl.
Add buttermilk and eggs. Beat until smooth.
Bake on a hot griddle to desired brownness.
Must use oil or baking spray to prevent sticking.

notes: Use oil or baking spray on griddle to prevent sticking

recipes.title: Breakfast Pizza
recipes.description: Hearty breakfast pizza with sausage, eggs, and hash browns.

instructions.text: Brown ground pork; drain.
Form crust with rolls on an ungreased 12 inch pizza pan. Spoon pork over crust.
Sprinkle with potatoes and mushrooms. Top with cheeses.
Beat eggs and milk. Pour into crust. Sprinkle on Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 375°F for 25 to 30 minutes.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Easy Cheesy Scrambled Eggs (Microwave)
recipes.description: Fluffy microwave scrambled eggs with bacon and cheese.

instructions.text: Place bacon on microwave safe rack or paper plate. Cover with paper towel. Microwave 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 minutes, or till done. Drain, crumble, and set aside.
In 1 quart casserole, combine green pepper, onion, and water. Cover and cook on HIGH 1 to 2 minutes, or until tender.
Stir in beaten eggs and cheese. Cook, uncovered, on HIGH 3 1/2 to 6 minutes, or till eggs are almost set, pushing cooked portions to the center several times during cooking.
Let stand till eggs are set. Sprinkle with crumbled bacon.

notes: Push cooked portions to center during cooking for fluffy eggs

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cream Cheese and Sausage Stuffed Crescents
recipes.description: Savory crescent rolls stuffed with maple sausage and cream cheese.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 375°F.
Crumble sausage links into bite-size pieces; place in large skillet. Cook over medium heat 5 min. or until done, stirring frequently. Drain.
Add sausage to cream cheese and crushed pepper in medium bowl; mix well.
Separate each can of dough into 8 triangles. Spoon cream cheese mixture evenly onto short sides of dough triangles, adding about 2 Tbsp. cream cheese mixture to each triangle.
Roll up, starting at short side of each triangle. Place, point sides down, on baking sheet.
Bake 14 to 16 min. or until golden brown.

notes: Make Ahead: Fill crescent triangles with cream cheese mixture and place on baking sheet as directed; cover. Refrigerate up to 12 hours before baking.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for refrigerated crescent dinner rolls

recipes.title: Granola
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 274
recipes.description: Choose your favorite nuts and fruits to make this crispy snack or cereal.

instructions.text: In a bowl stir together rolled oats, coconut, almonds or peanuts, sunflower nuts, and sesame seed. In another bowl combine honey or syrup and oil; stir into oat mixture. Spread evenly into a greased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 300° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till lightly browned, stirring after 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and immediately turn out onto a large piece of foil. Cool, then break into clumps. Store in tightly covered jars or plastic bags at room temperature for up to 2 weeks.

notes: Apple-Cinnamon Granola: Reduce rolled oats to 1 1/2 cups. Stir 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon into honey-oil mixture. Just before serving, stir in 1 cup coarsely chopped dried apple.
Raisin-Date Granola: After removing granola from the oven, stir in 1/3 cup raisins and 1/2 cup snipped pitted whole dates.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 274)

recipes.title: Grits
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 274
recipes.description: Southern-style grits, perfect for breakfast or as a side dish.

instructions.text: In a saucepan bring 2 cups water or chicken broth and 1/4 teaspoon salt to boiling. Slowly add 1/2 cup quick-cooking grits, stirring constantly.
Cook and stir till boiling. Reduce heat; cook and stir for 5 to 6 minutes or till water is absorbed and mixture is thick. Serve with margarine, butter, or milk, if desired.

notes: Cheesy Grits: Omit salt. Stir 1 cup shredded American or cheddar cheese and 1 tablespoon margarine or butter into hot grits till melted. Gradually stir about 1/2 cup of the hot grits into 1 beaten egg. Return all to the saucepan and stir to combine. Pour into a greased 1-quart casserole. Bake in a 325° oven about 25 minutes or till nearly set. Let stand 5 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 274)

recipes.title: Creamy Poached Eggs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Poached eggs served on muffins with creamy cheese sauce

instructions.text: Toast muffins or bagels; keep warm.
In a medium saucepan combine American cheese, cream cheese, milk, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, till cheese melts and mixture is smooth.
Meanwhile, poach eggs using water method.
Place muffin halves on serving plate. Top each with a poached egg.
Spoon cheese sauce over eggs. Serve immediately.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Poached Eggs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Basic technique for perfectly poached eggs

instructions.text: Lightly grease a saucepan. If desired, add 1 tablespoon vinegar to 2 inches simmering water in the pan.
Break one egg into a measuring cup. Carefully slide egg into simmering water, holding the lip of the cup as close to water as possible.
Simmer eggs, uncovered, for 3 to 5 minutes or till the whites are completely set and yolks begin to thicken but are not hard.
Remove eggs with a slotted spoon.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.

notes: Vinegar helps eggs hold together better in the water
To dip the egg into cold water for a few seconds helps firm up the edges

For poacher-cup directions: Grease each cup of an egg poaching pan. Place pan insert over boiling water in the pan; reduce heat. Break an egg into a measuring cup. Carefully slide egg into the greased cup. Cover and cook for 4 to 6 minutes or till whites are completely set and yolks begin to thicken but are not hard.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Eggs Benedict
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic brunch dish with Canadian bacon, poached eggs, and hollandaise sauce on English muffins

ingredients.item: Mock Hollandaise Sauce or Hollandaise Sauce

instructions.text: Toast English muffin halves.
Broil Canadian-style bacon 3 to 4 inches from the heat for 2 to 3 minutes or till lightly brown, turning once.
Place a bacon slice on each muffin half.
Top each with a poached egg.
Spoon Mock Hollandaise Sauce or Hollandaise Sauce over eggs.

notes: Eggs Florentine variation: Substitute fresh spinach leaves for the Canadian bacon
For Mock Hollandaise Sauce: place 2 egg yolks and 1 tablespoon lemon juice in a blender. Cover and blend till combined. With blender running, slowly add 1/2 cup melted butter in a steady stream.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

instructions.text: Mix the biscuit mix, margarine, and milk well; refrigerate 1/2 hour.
Meanwhile, mix the sausages and green chiles and let stand to room temperature.

Divide the dough in half. Roll out each piece to a large rectangle about 1/4 inch thick. Spread half of the sausage mixture completely over each piece of dough; roll up as for a jelly roll. Wrap in plastic wrap and freeze for 1 hour.
Remove from freezer and slice 1/4 inch thick. Freeze until ready to use. Then place the frozen slices on a cookie sheet and bake in preheated 400-degree oven for 20 minutes.
This is the perfect accompaniment to breakfast eggs, and it also makes a terrific appetizer.
Saute the onion in heated butter. Add the tortillas and chile powder, stirring well to coat the tortillas with powder. Cook until browned.
Add the eggs, green chiles, salt, and pepper; scramble.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and parsley.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Melt the butter in a skillet and saute the garlic and ham for 2 minutes. Add the mushrooms and green chiles and saute 2 more minutes.
Remove from the heat and stir in the sour cream, parsley, and oregano. Allow the mixture to stand for 10 minutes to blend flavors; then turn it into a buttered 1-quart casserole.
With a mixing spoon, make 6 rounded hollows in the chile mixture; break an egg into each hollow. Season with salt and pepper.

Bake about 20 minutes or until the egg whites are set. Sprinkle the grated cheese over the casserole and return it to the oven until the cheese is bubbling and the yolks are set, about 5 to 10 minutes more.
Garnish with olive slices.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Butter custard cups and break an egg into each. Add 2 tablespoons green chile sauce or salsa and top with a small slice of cheese.
Place cups in a pan of hot water and bake until eggs are set.

recipes.title: Baked Eggs with Cheese and Chile

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Whirl the eggs, milk, and cheese in a blender until mixed. Add the green chiles, salt, and pepper and pour into a buttered 9-inch square baking dish.
Bake for 25 minutes. Great for brunch or lunch or cold as an appetizer.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.

Butter an 8-inch square baking dish. Fry the bacon until almost done and drain off the excess grease. Mix the bacon with the corn, chiles, sugar, garlic powder, and salt. Spread the mixture evenly in the baking dish.
Mix the cream, eggs, and salt to taste and pour over the chile mixture. Sprinkle the cheese on top. Place on the center rack of oven and bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until the eggs are set.

recipes.title: Egg and Chile Omelet

instructions.text: Butter the bread and cut the slices in cubes. Layer the bread cubes, grated cheese, and chopped chiles in a 9-inch square baking dish.
Combine the remaining ingredients and pour over the bread cubes, cheese, and chiles. Let stand in the refrigerator overnight.
Cover and bake for 1 hour at 325 degrees. Remove the cover and bake 5 minutes more or until puffy and set.

notes: Make ahead - refrigerate overnight before baking

instructions.text: Prepare the pancake or waffle mix according to the package directions and set aside.

Crumble the sausage and saute it until well done. Drain off the fat. Reserve 3 tablespoons of the sausage and mix the rest along with 1/2 cup green chiles and 1/8 teaspoon of each of the spices into the pancake or waffle mix.

Empty the soup into a pan and add the milk, remaining chiles, and remaining spices. Add the salt and stir together. Heat the mixture to boiling and simmer 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and keep warm.
Prepare either pancakes or waffles and serve them hot with the cheese-chile sauce and sprinkled with reserved sausage. Great for breakfast or dinner.
Preheat griddle.
Mix the pancake batter with the cheese, corn, and green chiles. Fry like pancakes. Top them with tomatoes and green chiles.

recipes.title: Saintly Eggs

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°.

Butter a shallow casserole dish. Line dish with thin cheese slices. Break the eggs into the casserole dish, keeping them whole. Carefully pour cream over the eggs. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and salt and pepper and bake for 15 minutes or until egg whites are set and yolks are still runny. Brown the cheese topping under the broiler for a few minutes.

notes: Can be assembled night before, refrigerated, then popped into oven next morning

recipes.title: Wholly Pancakes

instructions.text: Night before: Soften the yeast in 1/2 cup of the water. Allow it to bubble, then add the rest of the water. Add both kinds of flour. Beat well and pour into a large pitcher with enough space on top for it to rise. Cover and store in warm place overnight.
The next morning stir down the batter. Remove 1 cupful and return to sourdough starter. Add the rest of the ingredients. Mix well and pour onto a hot griddle. Serves 4-6.

notes: Must be started the night before

instructions.text: Gradually add flour, salt and milk to eggs. Melt butter in 9 x 13 inch pan.
Pour batter over melted margarine.
Bake at 400 degrees for about 30 minutes. Serve with fresh sliced strawberries or syrup.
Sprinkle over top with remaining 1 cup shredded cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Crepe (Basic)

ingredients.prep_note: [RECONSTRUCTED - referenced in step 1 note about substitutions]

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in mixer and beat well, let batter stand 1 hour for more perfect crepes. (*Chicken or beef bouillon can be substituted for all or part of milk.)
The additions of onion, garlic or celery salt can also create a tasty crepe. Turn electric burner on to the middle of medium high, make sure pan is hot.
Pour batter into a pie tin or something shallow and dip the back of the pan into the batter to cover it, then place over the burner.
It takes only a few seconds to bake (practice makes perfect, you might ruin a couple) and then it peels off the pan onto a dish.

notes: Chicken or beef bouillon can be substituted for all or part of milk for savory crepes

recipes.title: Aebleskiver
recipes.description: Danish pancake balls

instructions.text: Separate eggs. Beat egg whites until stiff. Set aside.
Mix flour, buttermilk, baking powder, salt, baking soda, sugar, and melted butter with egg yolks.
Fold in beaten egg whites.
Heat Aebleskiver pan and grease cups. Fill cups 2/3 full with batter.
When bubbles form, turn with a fork or skewer to cook the other side until golden brown.
Serve warm with powdered sugar, jam, or syrup.

notes: Requires special Aebleskiver pan

recipes.title: Broccoli Bread Quiche

ingredients.prep_note: beaten, or equivalent no cholesterol egg substitute

instructions.text: Toast bread lightly; cut each slice in half.
Arrange bread slices in a small non-stick baking pan.
Layer broccoli on top.
Stir yogurt into eggs until blended, then spoon over broccoli.
Sprinkle with nutmeg, salt and lemon pepper.
Bake, uncovered, in a preheated oven at 350°F for 60 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.

notes: Healthy alternative to traditional quiche

instructions.text: Melt butter in 10" fry pan.
Combine 3 tablespoons sugar with cinnamon, sprinkle over butter.
Arrange apple slices over sugar mixture in pan. Cook over medium heat 3 to 4 minutes. Cool slightly.
Meanwhile, beat together eggs, milk, flour, remaining 1 tablespoon sugar and salt until smooth.
Pour gently over apple slices.
Bake in preheated 400 degree oven about 15 minutes until golden brown and sides are puffy.
Serve immediately.
Thoroughly drain strawberries, reserving 1/4 cup juice for topping. Chop 1/2 cup drained strawberries; reserve remainder for topping.
Prepare Strawberry Fluff: combine whipped topping, 1/3 cup sour cream, and reserved strawberry juice; set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and baking soda.
In another medium bowl, mix eggs, milk, sour cream and oil. Add to flour mixture.
Add 1/2 cup chopped strawberries. Stir only until combined; the batter will still be lumpy.
Preheat griddle. Brush preheated griddle with oil.
Using 1/4 cup batter for each pancake, cook until golden.
Serve with Strawberry Fluff and reserved strawberries.
Gradually add flour, salt and milk to eggs.
Melt butter in 9 x 13 inch pan.
Pour batter over melted margarine.
Bake at 400°F for about 30 minutes.
Serve with fresh sliced strawberries or syrup.

recipes.title: Basic Crepe

instructions.text: Place all ingredients in mixer and beat well, let batter stand 1 hour for more perfect crepes.
Turn electric burner on to the middle of medium high, make sure pan is hot.
Pour batter into a pie tin or something shallow and dip the back of the pan into the batter to cover it, then place over the burner.
It takes only a few seconds to bake (practice makes perfect, you might ruin a couple) and then it peels off the pan onto a dish.

notes: *Chicken or beef bouillon can be substituted for all or part of milk
The additions of onion, garlic or celery salt can also create a tasty crepe

instructions.text: Scramble desired number of eggs (with milk, salt, pepper) and cook allowing 2 eggs per 3 crepes.
Add chopped chives, sauteed onions and shredded cheese for additional flavor.
Place two tablespoonfuls of scrambled eggs on each crepe.
Place a cooked sausage link in the middle.
Fold crepe and pour a small amount of diluted cream of mushroom soup over the top; serve hot.
Make them up and put them in a microwave for a few seconds just before serving.
In a small mixing bowl combine softened cream cheese and crushed pineapple, well drained.
Split and layer 6 English muffins and place on baking sheet.
Spoon pineapple mixture using 1 1/2 tablespoon mixture for each.
Sprinkle with chopped pecans.
Bake at 375°F for 6 to 8 minutes. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Baked Spanish Potato Omelet

instructions.text: Beat eggs until fluffy.
Fold in remaining ingredients.
Spray a round, non-stick cake pan with cooking spray for no-fat frying.
Spoon in omelet mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 25 to 30 minutes until eggs are set.
Cut into wedges.

notes: The cooked ham can be replaced with leftover roast poultry, seafood or water packed tuna

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Blend in vanilla.
Add combined dry ingredients alternately with sour cream mixing well after each addition.
In another small bowl combine nuts, sugar and cinnamon; mix lightly.
Pour half the batter into greased 10" tube pan. Sprinkle with half the topping mix.
Repeat layers.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Cool 5 minutes and remove from pan.

recipes.title: Scalloped Eggs

instructions.text: Cut hard boiled eggs into slices and arrange in shallow buttered 9x13 pan.
Cook chopped onion in 2 tablespoons butter until tender.
Add 4 more tablespoons butter and 4 tablespoons flour. Cook a minute and stir in 2 cups milk and 1 cup chicken broth.
Season with salt and pepper. Cook until thick and pour over eggs.
Top with bread crumbs and dot with butter.
Bake at 375°F until hot and brown.

notes: Can make night before and refrigerate until morning. Then cook in oven.

recipes.title: Do Ahead Brunch Eggs

instructions.text: Beat eggs and milk together.
Add sherry and mushrooms to soup.
Scramble eggs in butter until just soft. Season with salt and pepper.
Put a layer of eggs in a casserole followed by a layer of soup and a layer of cheese. Repeat.
Sprinkle with paprika.
Can be done ahead to this point.
Bake in a 300 degree oven until heated through.

notes: Perfect for entertaining - can be assembled ahead

recipes.title: Maridadi Eggs

ingredients.prep_note: separated, taking care to keep yolks whole

instructions.text: Spread one side of each slice of toast with softened butter (or herb butter).
Beat the egg whites with salt until stiff, but not dry.
Mound the beaten whites on top of the 6 toast slices.
With a spoon, carefully lift one egg yolk and press into the center of the mounded egg whites on each piece of toast.
Bake in a very hot oven (475°F) for 4 to 6 minutes, or until the meringues are lightly browned (the yolks will still be runny).
Serve immediately.

notes: Yolks will still be runny when done

recipes.title: Crab Breakfast Casserole

instructions.text: Mix above together. Add: 1 tsp. dry mustard.
Place in a greased 9 x 9 inch casserole dish and let set in refrigerator overnight.
Remove from refrigerator 1 hour before baking.
Bake in a 325 degree oven for 1 hour.

notes: Must be refrigerated overnight before baking

recipes.title: Baked Eggs in Sour Cream
recipes.description: Here is a recipe for baking eggs in a delicious sauce. One of these baked eggs makes an ample serving if you spoon over it plenty of the rich cheese and sour cream sauce.

instructions.text: Grease individual baking dishes with butter.
Place cheese slices in bottom of dishes.
Carefully crack eggs on top of cheese.
Mix sour cream and light cream together, season with salt and pepper.
Spoon cream mixture over eggs.
Bake until eggs are set.
Garnish with parsley or paprika. Serve with toast if desired.

notes: One egg makes an ample serving with the rich sauce

recipes.title: Quick, Easy Lemon Coffee Cake
recipes.description: A simple coffee cake made with yellow cake mix and lemon filling.

instructions.text: Prepare cake mix according to package directions.
Make streusel by combining flour, sugar, cinnamon, and margarine.
Pour batter into prepared pan and top with streusel.
Bake according to cake mix directions.

notes: Recipe uses lemon filling - see full recipe for details

recipes.title: Cheese Grits Souffle
recipes.description: A Southern classic - fluffy cheese grits baked into a souffle.

instructions.text: Pour grits into boiling salted water in a heavy pan.
Stir constantly until thick and perfectly smooth.
Add butter, stir and remove from stove.
Add cheese, cayenne and egg yolks. Cool a bit.
Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry.
Fold into grit mixture, leaving large pieces of egg white showing.
Pour into 1 1/2 quart buttered casserole.
Bake 375°F (190°C) for 40 to 50 minutes until top is golden brown and firm in middle.

recipes.title: Baked Eggs in Sour Cream
recipes.description: A delicious way to bake eggs with plenty of rich cheese and sour cream sauce.

instructions.text: Here is a recipe for baking eggs in a delicious sauce. One of these baked eggs makes an ample serving if you spoon over it plenty of the rich cheese and sour cream sauce. 1 tsp.
Place cheese in baking dish and break eggs over cheese.
Mix sour cream and light cream together and spoon over eggs.
Season with salt and pepper.
Bake until eggs are set to desired doneness.
Serve over toast if desired, garnished with parsley or paprika.

recipes.title: Skillet Orange Coffee Cake
recipes.description: A coffee cake baked in an oven-proof skillet with an orange-bread crumb topping.

ingredients.item: Pillsbury's best all purpose or unbleached flour

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease 10 inch oven proof skillet.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup, level off.
In large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.
In small bowl, combine orange juice, oil and eggs; add to dry ingredients, mixing well.
In small bowl, combine bread crumbs, sugar, cinnamon, margarine and orange peel with fork until crumbly.
Pour batter into prepared skillet. Sprinkle topping evenly over batter.
Bake at 350°F for 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool 10 minutes; serve warm. 12 servings.

recipes.title: Cake Doughnuts
recipes.description: Classic homemade cake doughnuts fried in hot oil until golden brown.

instructions.text: Mix and leave in refrigerator overnight (makes easier to handle).
Roll dough out and cut doughnuts with a cutter.
Place in very hot oil.
Turn doughnuts as soon as they surface. With hot oil, need to be watched so they won't burn.

notes: Refrigerate dough overnight for easier handling

recipes.title: Grandma's Fry Cakes
recipes.description: Traditional fry cakes (doughnuts) made with buttermilk and fried in lard or shortening.

instructions.text: Beat eggs, add sugar, melted butter, vanilla and buttermilk. Add dry ingredients, mix well.
Cover. Store in refrigerator or overnight.
Roll dough about 1/2 inch thick, cut out.
Fry in hot lard or shortening until brown. Makes 3 dozen.

notes: Store dough in refrigerator or overnight before frying

recipes.title: Homemade Butter
recipes.source_note: Traditional butter churning from The Foxfire Book
recipes.description: Traditional churned butter with tips for proper temperature and handling.

instructions.text: Fill churn half or slightly over half full with rich milk which should be mostly cream.
Set the churn aside so the cream can 'turn' or clabber. In summer, pour up one night and churn the next. In winter, warm on alternate sides by fireplace for 3 days.
Test readiness: tilt the churn to its side - liquid should hold together in one form, separating cleanly from sides.
Insert dasher into churn, cover with lid (hole in center for dasher stick).
Agitate up and down for 30-40 minutes until butter gathers.
Remove lid and stir gently with the dasher in a sideways motion to bring butter together.
Lift lumps of butter out, drain, place in bowl.
Either chill overnight in refrigerator then mold with salt; or rinse with cold water immediately for fresher flavor.
Press butter into mold. Store in cool place.

notes: If clabbered cream is too warm: result is soft white puffy butter - add cold water to improve texture
If too cold: yields specks that won't stick together - stir in hot water to help gather
If left too long, cream will curdle and separate and won't make good butter
If churned too early while still 'blinky milk,' won't make good butter either
Liquid left after butter removed is buttermilk
Traditional chant: 'Come butter come, Come butter come, Peter standing at the gate, Waiting for a butter cake, Come butter come.'

recipes.title: Sorrel Omelet
recipes.source_note: Traditional Appalachian recipe from The Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: A fresh omelet made with wild sorrel leaves.

instructions.text: Wash and dry young sorrel leaves. Chop fine.
Add to eggs, with some onion.
Cook omelet.
When omelet is cooked, sprinkle more fresh sorrel leaves on top.

recipes.title: Dandelion Bud Omelet
recipes.source_note: Traditional wild food recipe from Foxfire Book 2
recipes.description: Fluffy omelet made with dandelion buds fried in butter.

instructions.text: Gather one cup dandelion buds before flower color shows.
Fry buds in a dab of butter until they pop.
Add four eggs, salt and pepper.
Cook as an omelet.
Top with raw dandelion leaves, finely cut, before serving.

notes: Gather buds before they show any yellow color for best flavor.

recipes.title: Cattail Pollen Pancakes
recipes.description: Pancakes made with cattail pollen for a golden color.

instructions.text: Combine dry ingredients.
Mix with egg, milk, and bacon drippings.
Pour dollar-sized amounts onto a hot griddle.
Cook until bubbles form, then flip.
